Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2013 07:58AM makaryne wrote: WOW!!!!! Three primaries?  I'm guessing it must feel as if you can never escape this disease?  Many blessings She.
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2013 08:17AM makaryne wrote: welcome debbiej.  I did not respond well to chemo this second time and felt so toxic the entire time.  Finally negotiate going off so that I could continue to have some semblance of a normal life - whatever that looks like.  The oncologist was very understanding and helpful as I refused treatment. It is still your free will  (even tho it often feels as if we have been thrust into something not of our choosing).  Coupled with the fact that not knowing what happens next, all any of us can do is try to find that quiet place (frequently involves sunning myself in various locales around the house) where we can ponder all of the information we are forced to confront since frequently, doing nothing, altough feeling easier, is akin to holding a weaon to our mouths.
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2013 09:59PM - edited Apr 19, 2013 10:01PM by makaryne 237 - used to be very active - continue to liaise with the women I met on breastcancer.org from 2006.  DX Stage IV- 10/16/2013 - metastasized breast cancer (bones, lungs, brain).  I will be 49 next week and am really feeling my age. I used to joke that I planned to retire at 50.  I didn't mean permanently!!!!
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2013 01:29AM makaryne wrote: I don't think this is a topic we necessarily need to shy away from.  On the one hand, I am grateful that Canada does not have an assisted suicide option since quite frankly there have been days when I might very well have made this decision for myself when things felt completely hopeless and when I've suffered tremendous pain.  On the other hand, however, when the time comes, and it eventually will, that the pain is too much to bear, I would seriously consider this option since I truly want to spare my husband and children from having to bear witness to suffering.    Big hugs to you in the meantime.
